ovdesc.p: This table contains the main definition of each Management Information database.
- the records that are to be included in the database,
- the columns that are to be maintained,
- the line structure that is to be used,
- what level of detail (consolidation) is the be kept in the database,
- whether the database is monthly, quarterly, etc,
- whether budgets are to be held for the database and, if so, at what level
It also contains information on the last time the database was built.

For example, the mi.db.definition record for the customer profitability (CP) database might state that all that only information for certain types of customer is to be included (identified by the sector of the customer) and that the customers id and the account officer responsible for the customer are to be passed forward to enable further analysis, and that columns are to be held showing average balance, interest income, and non-interest income.

Upon authorisation of the mi.db.definition record the application will automatically create the new management information database (the mi.data.xxxx file) and its associated Standard Selection record.

Specific values for each budget criterion that will be used during the automatic generation of mi.budget.line records.
Thus if you wish to budget for certain department/client combinations then these may be input here.
Two special values may be input:
EXIST will generate budgets for values that currently exist in the database
ALL will generate budgets for values on the REL.FILE
Examples:

If this database is being held at department and team level (consolidate.by of DEPARTMENT and TEAM and you wish to generate budgets for all department and team combinations that already exist on the database then the following should be input:
BUDGET.BY DEPARTMENT BUDGET.FOR EXIST BUDGET.BY TEAM BUDGET.FOR EXIST
Using the the same database - if you wish to budget for all departments that exist on the database but only for certain teams then the following could be input.
BUDGET.BY DEPARTMENT BUDGET.FOR EXIST BUDGET.BY TEAM BUDGET.FOR 100 Forex team BUDGET.FOR 102 Money Market team
Optional
Must exist on the REL.FILE for the budget field.
EXIST or ALL may be specified.
Additional, specific budget records may be specified here.
If the BUDGET.FOR mechanism is not able to specify certain, specific budget combinations then they may be manually input here.

For example if the majority of budgets are being maintained just for departments then the budget.for field would contain just DEPARTMENT. However if few specific customers within a particular department are also to have budgets set then these specific combinations may be specified in the ADDITIONAL field.
For example:
CONSOLIDATE.BY DEPARTMENT CONSOLIDATE.BY CUSTOMER.NO BUDGET.BY DEPARTMENT BUDGET.FOR EXIST ADDITIONAL 400_12547 ADDITIONAL 400_12554
The system would then create 'empty' budget structures for all departments that existed on the database and two additional budgets for department 400 and customers 12547 and 12554.
Optional
Fields must be in same sequence as consolidate.by and budget.by
Fields must exist in the appropriate related file (REL.FILE)
Fields must be separated by an underscore character (_)

Consolidation key fields e.g. CUSTOMER.NO or DEPARTMENT.
The database will be held at this level.
Thus if DEPARTMENT is specified then the database will be held at department level. It will thus be possible to produce reports by department.

If more than one CONSOLIDATE.BY field is specified then it will be possible to produce reports at one or both levels. This also enables a report to be produced at one level (e.g. department) and then further detailed analysis performed (such as at customer level) when required.
Note that this can be an I-descriptor field enabling associated information such as an account officers department code to be included.
